text: Came here with my kid, got a large pizza and wings, staff was friendly and food was great, will definitely be back for great food and even better service!

This place is literally right across the street from my house so I was anxious to give it a try, can't get any closer than this! I just ordered a double pepperoni pizza with their famous thin crust. It was absolutely delicious, I was not disappointed! They were generous with the sauce and the cheese too! They also have a drive through so you can order, run an errand, then come back to pick it up or phone in your order and pick up in the drive through. The only drawback might be if you like to dine in. There are only 3 tables in this tiny place that seat 2 people each but I personally like to bring my pizza home with me.  The ingredients all were fresh and delicious! I will definitely be coming back! My son loves wings so we'll also be giving them a try too!

The "Last Call" $6 dollar 1 topping medium pizza which is served from 8pm-10pm is a pretty good deal, the pizza tastes quite flavorful for that price point, wasn't greasy, and is infinitely better than Little Caesars $5 dollar Hot n Ready pizza, the thin crust isn't paper thin at all, the ingredients were fresh and it was ready in 15 mins. Great for kids or a quick pie if you're feeling lazy, this isn't a heartburn pizza it's a sweet deal. =)

They say 3rd time is a charm. I recently went to Vinny's for the 3rd time - more or less because its close to where I live and we(gf and I) wanted some pizza while heading out for the day.

The first 2 times I went the service was very slow, but could be expected because the place  had just opened. Giving the benefit of doubt, I assumed this was why(service was so slow) and gave it a 3rd try recently.

The 3rd experience, we ordered their pizza/soda special, which is basically a personal pan pizza and a soda.....After  watching 3 orders come in, and go out before us, and 30 minutes go by, I asked if the pizza would be out shortly and the manager(I believe - the guy giving orders anyway) said they would be out in 5 more minutes.

15 more minutes go by  and 1 more order out before us, that ordered after us, we finally get our pizza.

They did ask us if we wanted a free desert(for our wait), and said it would only take a couple minutes to prepare - We declined as we did not want to wait any longer.

The pizza, it was good - That's what the 2 stars were for.

Having tried their meat lover's pizza before and being happy with the taste, I decided to try their meatball sub. It arrived within half an hour of placing the order and delivery was free. The sub was still warm and the bread had a good crunch. I was pleased to find it wasn't a soggy catastrophe. I'm not sure what happened to the marinara sauce this time because it's usually more flavorful. All in all, not a bad deal for $7.99.

This place is pretty awesome. 

Their chicken fingers and wings are the reason to go there, first off. Their breading is perfect and they're just fresh and moist.  I'd go there over BWW's, Popeyes and Caine's any day of the week.

Salads are huge and a great value. I really like the garden salad with their Italian dressing. 

Pizzas are very well done.  I got the supreme and that delicious sucker was loaded with toppings like peppers, ham, sausage and bacon. Yes, that's right.  I suggest the thin crust, it's not super thin like most are used to.  

Delivery within 3 miles is free and staff is always friendly, a major plus when you're tired after work or just plain lazy like I am. 

Read the comments before mine and still decided to try the place. I asked the manager about their yelp reviews. Apparently there was a previous cook who kept messing up the orders and has since been replaced.

The large fed 3 adults so beware, pizza runs on the smaller size. Tasty thin crust, sauce is good and the cheese also.  I would buy from Vinny's again for sure but I would order in advance to avoid the ten minute wait.

Surprising little pizza place. Super friendly staff. Two 16" deep dish pizzas done in 20 minutes and they were delicious. 

The dough was not mushy or dry, it was very pleasant. The sauce had a nice blend of spices and it really made the pizza better. 

Overall I was kind of impressed. I didn't have high expectations for such a small place, but I'll definitely be there again.
Recently started to go to Vinny's as we moved to the area. Honestly I love their pizza. The thin crust is bomb and the people there are pretty cool as well. Will definitely continue to go.

We have pizza from this location semi-frequently. We like the flavor of the pizza. They struggle with order accuracy. Often the items are incorrect or the pie is cut incorrectly. (To get a "pie cut", you must request it). The staff seems disorganized and on other occasions we have had to wait, been given the wrong pizza and once found a long hair in the pie. 

We had practically given up but the last month or so we saw new faces and the experience had improved markedly. 

Unfortunately it looks as though this location may no longer be open. We have tried to order several times the past week or so and no one is ever there....

If I want lunch under $20 then this might be a good place to try ! I ordered a meatball sub with a drink and chips and a cannoli all for $14.59 . Are you enjoying the sub very delicious also I like that they give you extra sauce to make your sandwich saucy. I will call again for delivery

The pizza here is not bad. It's not amazing but it's also not horrible. I'd leave a 3.5 star rating for the taste. I'm more upset about the pizza size. I ordered a extra large 18" pizza for $20 and when I got it the pizza looked extra small. So I took a tape measure to it. It ended up being 50% smaller (12") than advertised. even smaller than a large. I honestly couldn't believe it. Be careful when ordering a standard large pizza.

Stopped this place by on our way to Las Vegas and I'm glad we did!  Pizza was awesome, crusty crust and the meat was delicious (we had Philly steak pizza).  There is also loads of other options on the menu, for example salads, pastas and subs.  The staff was very friendly and nice. Would recommend!

Drive through pizza place..... Need i say anymore. 

Yes because on mondays and tuesdays they have a special. Ten dollars for an xl two topping pizza. Like whattttt. Thats amazing. Me and my roommate were hungry and decided pizza is cheap and easy and seeing how were broke college kids what could be better. We were a little confused at first if the drive through was forreal and then we read the sign to honk, so we did. How fun! 

The pizza was made super quick. we got an xl sausage and pepperoni pizza. Needless the say we didnt have any leftovers. And we will definitely be back forsure since this place is across the street from us.
we got an XL pizza with wings, and it feed 5 adults! Love the sweet flavor of the sauce, good wings as well.
This is a really good pizza place that was quick, friendly with good service and pizza is better then Dominos and pizza hut!! Going back to try hot wings soon!

I'm back and forth between three stars and one, but the experience for me was less than expected to say the least. So 2 stars.  This was my first experience here based on these reviews and all I have to say is they must have a lot of friends.  I never expected to be sold an over done pizza but this is what I got from Vinny. The crust was more brown than golden and flat out dry.  Not so bad to make it not edible but over baked bread, which is the heart of any pizza makes a great pizza taste like a trip to Little Caesars when they toss undelivered pizzas.  Not a good first impression.

I love this place , I ordered their veggie delight pizza . Absolutely amazing & still ready when delivered . Called in again 2 minutes before closing & they had my order already saved & logged in under my phone number ... they still were able to take my order when closing in 2 minutes . Thank you guys so much . I'm looking forward to this delightful veggie pizza ! You guys rock

Tried this place today. In a very odd building on Maryland with a drive-thru pick up option. We did the lunch special which is a slice+20 oz soda for $4.25. The 'slice' turned out to be a 5 inch pizza which was a lot more food than I expected. Throw in a soda and you've got yourself a very good deal. The pizza was thin crust and quite good with crispy crust and flavorful sauce. I recommend.
Great pizza, friendly staff. Definitely a go too! The drive thru makes it quick and easy, pizzas always hot and time is always prompt. Garlic cheese bread is a must have if you visit here!

Good pizza!! I love their Lunch special.

I look forward to Fridays so I can have lunch at vinny pizzeria.  I love the sauce definitely makes the pizza.

Friendly service. Surprised the pizza tasted as good as it did. I was very happy. Knocked it down a notch because the red sauce was just sitting out. Isn't that supposed to be refridgerated? And the dough seemed like it was just sitting as scraps for the next order. Nevertheless, it tasted great. If you are the owner reading this, trust me, if you want this joint to succeed, you are going to HAVE to run a sick special like $5 or $6 pizza specials just to get traffic in your door to get people trying and talking about it. If people don't come in, they won't buy it, if they don't try it, they can't tell everyone how good it is.  Your food network advertisement is a silly ploy. Let the product sell itself.

Great pizza but their service and delivery times are unacceptable! We placed a delivery order at 6:45 tonight.  It's 8:45 and it still haven't arrived. We cancelled the order and won't be giving them anymore business.

Sorry for doing this because I really did like the place and the people running it before , but the new cooks are not good. Last few times I ordered here it has gone downhill a little each time and today I ate a couple pieces and threw the rest of it away. This place was great with the old cooks and they put out a really good pizza. Sadly I will have to resort going back to other places in the area and will not be going here again.

Their website and phone message say they open at 10am on Friday, but I couldn't get through until 10:45am. Ordered a 12in deep dish with pepperoni and chicken that cost $17+tip! Pizza tastes like it was frozen. Couldn't even finish a slice without having to spit some out in the trash. Overpriced nasty pizza.

I ordered a deep dish pizza. It was hot and cheesy which to me is a win win. I read the other reviews and I just had to visit myself. I found the staff pleasant. They made it easy to order. Its nice having options in my area.

We ordered chicken wings and pizza using a coupon the other day...Wow! Great flavor on the BBQ, tender chicken, great portion size and the pizza was also fabulous! Leftovers for 3 days! Go try them! So yum!

Good pizza and friendly staff.  So far I've had them deliver a Chicago style and a thin crust to my house.  Delivery was within an hour both times and delivery girl was super friendly.  Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because I wish the sauce had a bit more zest/kick to it.  It's a little bland for me.  Overall a good pizza and super convenient to my location.
The price is reasonable! I love the taste of the pizza here.. And its freshly baked! The staffs are so friendly...
Came here bc the yelp reviews were good, and needless to say I was very satisfied. We ordered  the lg 2 topping pizza for $10.99.. .It was delicious !

Lived in Vegas for 10 years, very hard to find a great Pizza all the time I was there . Moved to Denver, but back often to visit family . This is by far the Best Pizza I have had in Las Vegas  area . Great crust, sauce is flavorful, and topping fill the pie unlike others who skimp on toppings ! This is the best in pizza in the south Vegas- Henderson area!

Pizza! Vinny's is a new-ish spot that offers Chicago-style deep dish and thin crust pizza. They also have some of the standard apps - fried ravioli, etc. As we had a coupon for a thin crust, we opted for that. I like hat they offer some "unusual" toppings like blue cheese, hot giardiniera, shrimp, etc. As I like things spicy and cheesy, we opted for jalapenos, hot giardiniera, and blue cheese. And boy was it delicious! They slice the thin crust in squares. They also offer ranch as a dipping sauce for extra. They deliver, but we opted for pick-up to save some money. It's an old fast food spot, so there's a drive-thru. It's not one you can order at (since pizza can take so long), but is one where you can pick-up orders. I loved that we could drive up to a window to pick-up our order and not have to get out of the car. The staff was pleasant and order was correct and hot. And, of course, it was tasty. I can't wait to try their deep dish. All in all, an excellent pizza place.

I usually order for delivery. The location itself is very small, so I usually don't go there. 
There seems to be lots of hole in the wall pizza joints here in Vegas, which is nice, because I love the homey taste of places like this. 
The pizzas are always very good, but lately I've gotten into their subs. They have a pizza sub, a chicken parm sub, meatball sub and an Italian sub. They are all very flavorful and filling. Now since I make a big deal about value for your money, this is why I'm a fan: These subs are all $7.99. Considering that a footlong sub at Subway is $7.50 now, Vinny's is a far better value for my money than Subway. Screw Subway. 
Delivery has always been prompt and courteous. You can order easily online too which is very convenient.

Decided to try a new pizza place while looking through Ubereats and though I'd try a deep dish pizza.. When it arrived it was burnt and definitely no a deep dish pizza like I know it should be....just a regular pizza that was not cooked all the way...Thats what i get for trying...Should have stuck with my go to WINDY CITY BEEFS N PIZZA...I'LL only get my pies from there from now on!...Epic fail

Nice people, wasn't too long a wait and the price is very reasonable.  Why 3 stars?  I don't like the pizza.  As others have said, it's a sweet sauce.  Doesn't belong on a pizza in my world but if you like sweet sauce, this is your place. I feel bad giving a bad review here as I'm not displeased with anything about the business.  It's just not to my taste.

Glad to have a pizzeria within a block of my house again. I've ordered on a few occasions for pick-up and they have never disappointed.  The drive thru pick-up is a great option when you don't want to get out of your house clothes. I've only had the thin crust pizza which was very satisfying.  The sauce is a little sweeter than I'm used to but it still tastes great.  Chicken parm was on point and the calzones we're equally as great. There's usually a lady the answers the phone and handles the transaction at the drive thru...  She is always pleasant and seems genuinely thankful for your business. I will be back for sure!

If I could give this place no stars I would. Terrible pizza! Absolutely the worst pizza I have ever had. Frozen pizza is better. Their sauce is sugary. Their dough is obviously bought (sad cause it's so bad). Toppings were cheap. There are way better pizza within a mile or so (even Pizza Hut has better food). I don't see this place lasting longer then a month or two. Ordered for delivery, gave them a credit card. They had to call me 3 times to reenter the card, finally I said I'll just pay cash. Waste of money. Had to rebake the pizza and still ended up throwing 80%of it away.
It was typical and good. Nothing I'd scream from the mountains about but reliably good when you just want pizza.
This pizza is not good at all. The dough and sauce have no flavor and the crust burnt but the middle was a little undercooked.

Never had Vinny's pizza until one fateful day I stopped at a friend's house... I think it was a thin crust with pepperoni and sausage, square cut.... Omg.... The sauce is frickin' amazzzzing! So perfect!!! I wish this pizzeria was a little closer to my house near 215 and Decatur but it is still so good I will drive the extra couple miles to grab a pick-up.... Hands down the best pizza I have had in Vegas [so far]!
A little pricey but good. Order or pick up is usually ready in 15 minutes as promised. Staff were always nice on our visits.

The pizza was overall ok.  The crust wasn't done enough and was extremely doughy!!  I enjoyed the flavor of the sauce but my daughter thought it had too much sauce on it.  They delivered very quickly (less than 30 minutes for a large pizza) and the price was very reasonable but I would not order from here again.

A definite go to place when you're craving deep dish pizza! Very very good! I'm a meat lover so I opted for the meat lovers, and it was packed with perfectly crisped pepperoni, bacon, sausage! Also, fried ravioli is a tasty appetizer to try. I personally didn't like the wings, but everyone else who ate devoured them, so something must be right!

Would give em 3.5 stars on the average....

The good..fast free delivery...adrived hot and fresh...exactly as ordered.

Was pleased by the size of the salad...good deal for 5 bucks, and was more than enough for 2-3 people.

BBq wings were ok...too sweet forbmy tastes.. a bit pricey... i wouldnt repeat.

The pizza was pretty darn good... going deep disa was nearly $4 more though... would stick with the standard crust in the future..

Pizza was good, but nothing spectacular... probably wouldnt repeat, but thats just me.. it served the purpose.

We heard this place was good so we ordered a lot of food. Didn't finish a thing and the only thing we saved were the chicken fingers. Breadsticks were the worst thing we ordered. It was just burned pizza crust. The taco pizza on thin crust was not delicious at all neither was the all meat pizza Chicago style. I don't remember what sandwich my friend ordered but she didn't eat it either. On a better note, the delivery was free and the kid who delivered it was nice. Definitely not going to order from here again!!

I'm from Chicago so i was excited to try their Chicago pizza. Ordered plain cheese medium. Pizza arrived with burnt crust which ruined the taste for me. Also ordered small 5"taco pizza. Menu advertised it comes with sour cream on the side. However, there was no sour cream on the side or on the pizza. The cannoli were fine. But after spending $30+, i was not happy with the burnt pizza and no sour cream. Disappointing.

I ordered a gluten free pizza and my husband ordered the meatball sub. The delivery was fast and seem less. I enjoyed the pizza. The crust was thin and tasty and the toppings were great. My husband said the meatball sub was one of the best he ever tasted. We will be ordering again.

Worst experience ever ordering a pizza. I ordered a pepperoni mushroom tonight and gave the lady my address and apt #. When she read the addy back she didn't get the apt # so I repeated it and she said nothing after except "We'll be there in 30-40 minutes."

     30 or 40 minutes later I get a call from the driver saying "The dispatched never gave your apt # and I can't find you." I go outside and find the guy driving around and eventually flag him down. I gave him a 20 dollar bill on an $11.89 check and he rifles through his pockets and holds up 2 one dollar bills. "This is all I have man." He went on to claim that almost all of their orders are credit cards even though I told the dispatcher I was paying cash. I said "I guess this is your lucky day" and give him the 20. He says "Thanks" and walked away without even offering to give me the 2 dollars in change.

    What a piece of crap delivery driver, but it gets worse. When I get back inside to eat my pie, I open the box to find a smashed up pizza (picture attached) and of couse right on cue the pizza is old and cold. This is the first and last time Vinny's will get a call from me.

First time ordering from Vinny's. Let me start by saying that the lady that took my order over the phone (Nicole) was super nice,and helpful. Had my order delivered and the delivery guy was also very nice. (Didn't catch his name).  I ordered their garden salad, baked chicken fingers, pepperoni calzone and there garlic bread. I have no negative reviews. The baked chicken fingers are soooo incredibly delicious! The salad was very fresh crispy, and delicious as . My kids loved the pepperoni calzone ( I'm not much of a tomato sauce fan) we were so full after all the food that we only took a bite out of the garlic bread which is so yummmy! I def recommend Vinny's and I will be ordering again and trying something new.

Don't do it! Delivery took an hour and a half. First time I ordered from here and last. Pizza is average at best. So 20 bucks for this medium Pizza ah hell no! I just threw away take out menus so I don't make that mistake again.

One of the best pizzas that I've ever had in my life. I tried Vinny's on a whim due to tiring of the nearby Subway's evening choices, and was not disappointed. Although Vinny's delivers and has very limited seating both inside and out, I decided to dine in anyway since I didn't have much to do on an early Saturday afternoon.

The very enthusiastic & jovial female blonde employee recommended the deep dish stuffed pizza after I saw another employee take it out of the oven for a delivery. For a medium pizza that has eight slices, the pizza is a bit on the pricey side (about $17-18), and takes about 20 minutes to make. I had planned on waiting at one of the tables anyway, yet was slightly disappointed that there wasn't any WiFi at this venue (unlike everyone else). No worries. The time went by fast as it is. 

When presented with the pizza, I felt as if the box weighed between 5-7 lbs. My first reaction was "Holy f**k, that's one stuffed pizza!" Along with a Pepsi (no alcohol served here), I could only eat about four slices. I made up my mind to take the other four slices back to the hotel for later due to my stomach being stuffed as thoroughly as a Thanksgiving turkey. The flavoring of the pizza (only a sausage, pepperoni and onion variety) was blended in correctly, and the end product itself wasn't undercooked, or overcooked. 

This was certainly one of the best Chicago-style pizzas that I've had in a long time that would make any Giordano's or Lou Malnati's proud. That, and you'll get good service too.
Don't come here if your looking for a quick slice. It took them over 30 mins to make 2 5in personal pizzas. Customer service was awful. Never going here again!

Disgusting and by far THE WORST pizza I have ever had in my whole life. The frozen pizza I buy at Walmart is way better! My husband and I tried this for the first time since we drive by it every day and ultimately we should've just kept driving. Very disappointed. If you're in the mood for cardboard with sugary tomato sauce this is the place to go. Plus seems like a bunch of stoners who don't wash their hands before making the food work here. We will never come here again.

I used to love this place.  Used to have great stuffed and Chicago style pizza.  I stopped ordering from here several months ago because the service was degrading as was the pizza quality.

I order a large stuffed meat lover's pizza for delivery. (in the past, we always went to the location for pick up) It came fairly quickly.   It was burnt (see picture posted)  clearly burnt.  Dark black on the edges?  I know they have to put this pizza through twice.  It's always been a little darker on the edges, but never black black.  

I call in immediately and ask what's the deal?  The person who answered simply told me "It's not burnt, it just looks that way because it has to go through the oven twice."  umm?  Ok, this is the only type of pizza I have ever ordered from your place.  I've ordered maybe 10 of them in the last year.  They have never come out BLACK.  The remedy was, "I can give you credit for another pizza for next time."  I don't think there will be a next time.

Get your customer service together.  You could have offered to send another pizza immediately.  Oh wait, you could have LOOKED at the pizza and not sent it out in the first place.  

Avoid, there are a dozen other pizza places in the area.

Small place = Big taste!
OMG, this pizza is gooooooooooooodddddddddd!
I've been sitting on this coupon for over 1 month.  I just wasn't sure about trying a new pizza place.  So I decided to give it a try.  So I called in my order, she said 15 min.  So we headed on over.  She knew who we were (huh) ok, but she said our pizza got stuck, and it would be a few extra min.  She offered us a free drink or a canola.  We took the strawberry canola.   Got home and we tore right into it. hummmm, this is pretty good!  As we were getting into it, OMG, it was really, really good!  I don't know what Chicago pizza taste like, but I like the pizza on 8716 S. Maryland pkwy.   We have found our favorite pizza place!

Ordered pickup through eat24 and went to get it.  The location has very easy access but the building is super small.  It has a drive thru because it used to be a different sort of restaurant, although if you order to go you can pick it up at the drive thru, which is cool.

I got a large Chicago style deep dish with pepperoni, bacon, and sausage for $20.  Decent sized pizza, but I was expecting it to be "deeper."  Definitely the edge crust was high, but everything else about the pizza seemed normal (a little thicker than Papa John's normal crust, a little thinner than a Pizza Hut pan pizza). Good amount of cheese, the bacon was actual cut up strips, and the sausage and pepperoni were good.  

Employees were cheery and I'm definitely looking forward to going back and trying the stuffed crust pizza next time!

This is my favorite pizza place. The marinara sauce is so good not salty at all. Sometimes the service is a little slow but the food makes up for it. 

It's a tiny place. Not much of a sit and dine. All this said don't let the size of the place fool you. Eery time me and my gf want pizza this is the only place we can think of.

They lose a star for atmosphere. Do not dine in. Delivery or take out. 3 tiny tables. The tables are so tiny I knocked over my husband drink all over him. 

Ranch: sucks
Pizza: nothing special but not bad 
Atmosphere: HORRIBLE
Staff: very nice
Beverages: NO Ice in the restaurant & SINK water only

We were in the mood for a deep dish Pizza, so we thought we would have Vinny's Pizzeria deliver a medium Pepperoni, Mushroom, and Sausage Pie. The pie was delivered hot and fresh in 31 minutes. They had estimated 45-60 minutes.

The crust was a perfect golden brown on the bottom, and cooked through on top. The flavor was hampered by too little salt in the dough mixture. The sauce was slightly sweet, and lacked any Basil or Oregano flavor, which was a minus. The toppings were fresh and had very good flavor, but the amount of toppings was disappointing.  

All in all, here's how I graded the experience:

Ease of ordering.                    A
Delivery time.                          A
Delivery temperature.             A
Cooked properly.                    A
Quality and amount - Sauce.  B
Q&A Dough.                            B
Q&A Cheese.                          A
Q&A Toppings.                        B-
Value.                                      B        

Overall grade B+. With more salt in the dough, a less sweet and more herbal sauce, and more toppings, this experience would have been a solid A. 

We will order from Vinny's again soon, there are several items on the menu we would love to try.

My husband and I have ordered from Vinny's a handful of times.  We loved it, especially the wings and the fingers because they are baked not fried. The kids loved the pizza. After a long, rainy weekend, we decided to stay home on a Sunday night and order in dinner.  We called at 7:17pm....8 piece fingers with ranch, 15 piece wings plain with a side of their house sweet sriracha and a side of ranch and a side salad with 1000 island. The girl who answered the phone repeated my order back perfectly and advised me it would be 45 minutes until delivery.  55 minutes later our food arrived. My husband grabbed the fingers, the order was fine. I opened the wings to find 2 sides of ranch that was WARM and no house sweet sriracha. I threw away the ranch and grabbed my bottle out of the fridge. Now onto my side salad...no 1000 island, but a side of Italian.  Extremely disappointed.  The sad part is, the food wasn't that great. Mediocre at best. Sad that the quality of food has gone down and their attention to detail on our order wasn't that great either. PS...I can't imagine anyone liking warm ranch with their wings...you should consider how to repackage and send the sides when you are delivering.

Being Italian from New York I know pizza .the staff was very friendly and accommodating but I want my money back . The texture of the pizza was good but the sauce was so sweet it was gross . I tried dumping parm and salt on it but it didn't help . Not happy

Best pizza in The area, I always love coming here, the staff is super friendly and if there is ever a problem they jump to fix it. Delivery is super fast and that goes without mentioning it's free within 3 miles! DEEP DISH PIZZAS are the way to go! I also love that everything is baked and not fried. Super bomb chicken strips! This place is a must try.

Ehhh. I've had better, much better. I was really excited to try their pizza since I always drove by their small restaurant and was curious. Went in and ordered a pepperoni pizza. While waiting, I noticed ants crawling all over the tables and walls. I ended up checking in on Facebook so I got a free cannoli. When I got home and tried the food, I was disappointed. Crust was burnt but slightly doughy on the inside. Taste was bland. Cannoli was rock hard... Maybe I came in on an off day? I won't be coming back.

The pizza is s terrible. They use sauce so sweet it could be candied tomato sauce. NOT a good thing. And please....warn or post or something to tell your patrons that you're a Chicago style pizza joint. Most people I know don't like dopey square pieces of pizza. While they did offer to remake the pizza my husband declined, as he was starving and didn't want to wait another 45 minutes for what ended up being the WORST pizza we've ever had in Vegas. You know it's bad when you go to eat a piece cold the next day and it's worse than the night before. If I could give zero stars I would. But they get one by default. Save your money and go to Dominos.

This is a new Pizza joint opened up 2 days ago.  I've been keeping my eye on this place because I'm a pizza fan and it's on my commute on Maryland.  When I saw the "now open" sign I was excited to get a slice.

I walked into the long skinny building and ordered a medium Hawaiian pizza for take out.  I only waited about 10 minutes and was on my way home.  The toppings were fresh.  The pineapple was big and juicy, the Canadian Bacon was great.  They do not skip on the sauce and cheese.  The mozzarella was excellent, the sauce was great.  The crust tasted good but it was just a little too soft for me.

I highly recommend checking this place out.  I will be back to try more pizza and maybe some wings.

So we ordered online for pickup, mistake 1. They tell me 15 minutes,  30 minutes later I got my pie. Ordered black olive and half pepperoni half bacon, it was a super poor cheese. Won't order here again.

Tried them a 3rd time and decided to try the wings.

Easily among the worst wings I've ever had in my entire life.

Very mushy.

Did get a lot of sauce, though.....

Bummed I have to write this because I really wanted a pizza place by our house that the whole family could enjoy. The breadsticks and pizza was fine and my husband and kids were happy.... But my grilled chicken salad was absolutely inedible. The lettuce was frozen in the middle and everywhere else was slimy and rotten. The chicken on top looked like croutons it was so hard and dry. I honestly thought they forgot the chicken until I realized it was the "grilled chicken" portion of the salad. I honestly could not even bring myself to take a bite & I'm the least picky eater. 

So so so disappointed.

This is the second time I have ordered delivery and the second time they have gotten my order wrong.

I like this place, the food is good when they get it right but unfortunately when the don't put what you say on the receipt, dry wings sauce on the side, you get the wings soaked in sauce.

Nicole is awesome, she has never gotten my order wrong but the two times a guy answered my order has been wrong.  The first time was pizza with topping olives on the pizza instead of being left off as requested.

Like I said this place has great food unfortunately the order taker does not always listen.

I will continue to order from here but will need to go in and check my food before I leave the place to ensure I get what I paid for.

The other issue today, I was told the driver would be back to the store in 20 minutes and they would get the food right out to me, an HOUR AND A HALF is how long it took to get the order delivered wrong.

I've ordered from Vinny's twice in the last month. Both times the orders were exactly what I ordered, fast friendly delivery and bomb ass pizza. Their Monday and Tuesday specials are ridiculously good. I tried deep dish and thin and while both were great the thin crust won. This is my new go to pizza place. And I've been in 89074 for 14 yrs so that saying something!
The thin crust pizza is good. A lot better than the deep dish. Pizza sauce is sweet, which I like. This pizza is like candy for men. If you don't like this pizza, we probably can't be friends.

The first time I came here(opening nite) I got a medium pepperoni pizza, and baked chicken breast. The chicken was amazingly good. Better than deep fried, and healthier!  The pizza was more acquired, though. The sauce was sweet for me. 

I almost never came here again after I called to get some chicken at least 2x more and they said they had no more chicken. 

On my latest visit, it was 100% better! The thin crust pizza was actually thin and did not taste sweet.  It was awesome!  The chicken was amazing,  as usual. 
**Ask for extra ranch** (if you like ranch)

Edit: Wow, after reading Jonathan's post about there being a cook who wasn't cooking the food correctly is totally understandable now XD. Thanks for going that extra mile to help us Yelpers out

burnt, chewey, very chewey, hard, lifeless, tasteless. since the crust is inedible, I'm only getting like a half a pizza. I'm only giving it 2 stars because i liked the little bits of cheese in the side salad,  NO croutons available here!! I feel sad after eating here....

What is this!!!!  Ordered a Chicago deep dish,and got nothing of the sort.  According to the menu, and my wife being a native of Chicago this is far from it.  More like a pan pizza, no sauce on top, and crust that literally was drug through hell and was burnt beyond recognition.  If your going to charge deep dish prices, deliver a deep dish pizza.  Very disappointed!!!

Free delivery pizza. I ordered a regular meatlovers pizza (thin crust). Pizza was hearty and is what I've expected. Sauce was a little on the sweet side which was quite tasty. Delivery came earlier than the projected time. Overall, a great experience. Would definitely recommend and order here again.
Never seems busy but the pizza and wings are really good. Been there several times and always good quality and on-time service.

Placed a timed order for a 630 pick up for one large cheese a stuffed crust with ham and pepperoni and bread sticks  I arrived at 635 and the pizza was wIting I was handed the box and the product wasn't even hot it was very light warm the cheese was no longer hot and string the breadstick looked like they had been sitting for a least an hour so disappoint in the stuffed crust pizza the pepperoni and ham was no where to find I wanted some real east coast style pizza and that is not what I got very disappointing I will just take my $$and give it to Pizza Hut  unless things get better we won't be back
I ordered from here on the advice of a friend and was not disappointed.  The pizza is good, toppings are fresh and delivery was prompt.  Recommend.

This was our only choice when we stopped after a Hoover Dam tour and we had to order from a special menu. While I know its for efficiency,  we were only able to order like 4 things or the buffet. We chose the buffet so we could be done eating in the time we were allowed. The buffet was extremely small. Salad bar consisted of lettuce that nothing else mixed, just big chunks of lettuce, cheese and three dressings that weren't labeled so I can't even say what they were. The buffet had  maybe 3 different pizzas, one kind of pasta and deep fried zucchini. I don't like to put small businesses down but I'd probably try another place next time.

Good place small only 2 people working for lunch service is good and quick lunch special is under $6 one topping pizza and a drink. Pizza was good but sauce is pretty sweet but not bad just a little too sweet. Great for a place when you need 20-30 min break for lunch 6 chairs in the whole place and no other sit down customers in sight!

Good quality pizza! Very illusive in vegas for some reason? This is the fourth or fifth time we have been here and it keeps you craving more! It's a thin-er style pizza and the sauce has just a hint of sweetness to it. Reminded me of donatos from back east. This is our favorite pizza spot in town.
